Sub: Dispensing with Stamping of Boarding Pass : reg.  
 
Please find enclosed herewith a copy of SDG/APS, New Delhi Office letter no O-
42011/APC/OPS(2)/Circular/AS/20-3943 dated 14th May 2020 and Joint Director General, 
BCAS, New Delhi office letter No. F.NO. CAS-26(1)/91/Div-I(E-Boarding Pass)-87868 
dated 13th May 2020 on the above cited subject (copy enclosed). 
 
02. 
In view of the prevailing situation of COVID-19 pandemic and counter measures 
being taken to contain its spread by touch/contact, it has been decided to dispense with 
the procedure of stamping the passenger’ Boarding Pass that is being done by Aviation 
security Group/ APSU after completion of pre-embarkation security check of the 
concerned passenger, till further orders. 
 
03. 
In this regard, the dispensing with stamping of Boarding Pass for domestic 
passengers of Terminal-2 is already in practice since last one year and domestic PAX 
from Terminal-2 are validated by e-gates. However, for Terminal-1 and GA Terminal 
below measures shall be ensured 
 
i. 
Passenger may be advised to hold his/her mobile/paper boarding pass before the 
CCTV Camera in such a manner that image of boarding pass as well as passenger 
is captured properly. In this regard, MIAL has already been informed that CCTV 
camera shall be placed somewhere near the Queuing Assistant duty point, 
because after this the passenger is supposed to place his mobile phone in the X-
BIS input roller. 
 
04. 
The SHA I/C and GO should actively be present in this area to resolve any 
complaint regarding taking a photograph of the passenger and his/her boarding pass. A 
copy of the above BCAS AVSEC Order should also be readily available in SHA for 
addressing any passenger grievance. 
 
05. 
This issues with the approval of DIG/CASO

Sub: Dispensing with Stamping of Boarding Pass (Addendum to AVSEC Order
No. 02/2000 )

Enclosed please find a copy of BCAS letter vide No. CAS- 26(1)/91/Div-I (E-Boarding
Pass) - 87868 dated 13.05.2020.

2. In view of the Coronavirus epidemic, BCAS has dispensed with the procedure of
stamping the passenger's Boarding Pass, till further orders.

3. _In view of the BCAS directions, CASOs along with Airport Director will identify the most
suitable locations for installing the high definition fixed CCTV cameras and supporting
infrastructure. The idea is that the CCTV camera should be able to digitally capture the image
of the boarding pass a5 well 2s identity (not the Identity Card) of the passenger. Therefore,
the correct placement of the CCTV camera is very important,

4. It is suggested that the CCTV camera can be placed somewhere near the Queuing
Assistant duty point, because after this the passenger is supposed to place his mobile phone in
the X-BIS input roller. However, any other appropriate location may also be decided locally.

5. Passenger may be advised to hold his/her mobile/paper boarding pass before the CCTV
Camera in such a manner that image of boarding pass as well as passenger is captured
properly.

6. All CASOs are also directed to adequately sensitize all GO In-Charges, SHA I/Cs and
screeners. The SHA I/C and GO should actively be present in this area to resolve any complaint
regarding taking @ photograph of the passenger and his/her boarding pass. A copy cf the
above BCAS AVSEC Order should also be readily available in SHA for addressing any passenger
grievance.

7. Allairline operators should also be sensitized about this change in security procedure by
conducting a special APSC (Airport Security Committee) meeting along with all stakeholders.
8. _ Issued for strict compliance.
